Sentencas: Investigation of fuels containing sulfur impurities is important regarding durability of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) because they are present in various potential fuels for SOFC applications.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The effect of H2S in the ppm range on the performance of state-of-the-art anode supported SOFC at 850 and 750 degrees C is evaluated in either hydrogen/steam or hydrogen/steam/CO fuel.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It was found that the poisoning effect is more severe in H-2/H2O/CO vs. H-2/H2O fuel.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Only similar to 8 ppm H2S can be allowed in the CO containing fuel without risking damage to the anode, whereas 90 ppm (or even more) is possible in H-2/
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: H2O. Impedance spectroscopy revealed that the poisoning effect in H-2/
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: H2O is due to an increase of the polarization resistance in the high frequency range, which is related to the electrochemical anode reaction.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In H-2/H2O/CO, both the polarization and serial resistance increase.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the polarization resistance increased both in the high and low frequency region, which indicates a strong poisoning of the water gas shift reaction and thus a lack of hydrogen fuel in addition to the poisoning of the electrochemical hydrogen oxidation.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: All poisoning effects are reversible under the applied operating conditions.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of the Water Gas Shift Reaction on Anode Supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
